data.body:
Let's rewrite the README so it looks more like a typical readme (use the steve yegge beads repo as a kind of example)

we should describe foolery as "Product focused agentic orchestration tool - one layer up from managing 8 agent terminals, one level down from massively multi-agent chaos."

problems it solves:

rapid scratch pad for small bugs and big ideas alike
leverage agents to organize groups of work and optimize them for parallel execution
track "completed" work units in a first-class way, accept or reject them with notes.

and anything else you think cool about the app.  :-)

we want to highlight the git driven install flow (the one liner) as a quick start - noting beads as a requirement

we want to highlight the beats, scenes, direct, and final cut views - brief descriptions of what they do, with placeholders for screenshots.
